title: Sodium silicate
summary: Sodium silicate is a generic name for chemical compounds with the formula Na2xSiyO2y+x or (Na2O)xÂ·(SiO2)y, such as sodium metasilicate Na2SiO3, sodium orthosilicate Na4SiO4, and sodium pyrosilicate Na6Si2O7.  The anions are often polymeric.  These compounds are generally colorless transparent solids or white powders, and soluble in water  in various amounts.
